intro: Hedychium marginatum, commonly known as the golden ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features tall, slender stems with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white margins. Its most striking feature is its fragrant, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters at the top of the plant. Hedychium marginatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
